mesa 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Reference

    All functions

    BSgenome.Hsapiens.NCBI.GRCh38.CpG.distribution

    Pre-calculated CpG distribution values for GRCh38

    FantomRegions

    FANTOM5 regions for GRCh38

    GRCh38.99.gtf

    GTF file for GRCh38.

    addBamCoveragePairedAndUnpaired()

    This function adds coverage to the qseaSet, using both paired reads and the high-quality R1s.

    addHMMcopyCNV()

    Calculate and add CNV based on HMMcopy, on individual samples

    addHyperStableFraction()

    This function calculates and summarises the proportion of hyperstable regions that are present in each sample, and adds to columns of the sampleTable

    addLibraryInformation()

    This function takes a qseaSet and adds the information on the number of reads into the sampleTable for easier access.

    addMedipsEnrichmentFactors()

    This function takes a qseaSet and adds the Medips-style enrichment scores to the object sampleTable.

    addQseaNormalisationSteps()

    This function takes a qseaSet and adds several normalisation steps

    annotateData()

    Add annotation onto a data table

    arrange(<qseaSet>)

    This function extends the function dplyr::arrange to act on qseaSet, to reorder the samples in the qseaSet.

    arrangeQset()

    This function takes a qseaSet and sorts the samples inside it using dplyr::arrange, using a column(s) of the sample table. Can also use desc() to reverse sort, as in dplyr::arrange.

    calculateArrayBetas()

    This function calculates the beta values for the windows covering the hg38 array probes.

    calculateCpGEnrichment()

    This function takes a path to a bam file and calculates the enrichment scores.

    calculateCpGEnrichmentGRanges()

    This function takes a GRanges object and calculates the enrichment scores.

    calculateDMRs()

    Fit the GLM and return the data

    calculateFractionReadsInGRanges()

    This function calculates the fraction of reads in a qseaSet object which are present in a GRanges object

    calculateGenomicCGDistribution()

    This function takes a BSGenome and returns a data frame with the relH and GoGe parameters used for calculating enrichment

    colnames(<qseaSet>)

    This function extends the base function length to return the number of samples in the qseaSet

    combineQsets()

    Combine two qseaSets

    combineQsetsList()

    Combine two qseaSets

    countWindowsOverCutoff()

    This function takes a qseaSet and sums over nrpm within a GRanges object

    downsampleQsea()

    This function takes a qseaSet and downsamples the reads.

    dropAvgFragDetails()

    This function removes the avgFragmentLength and avgFragmentMAPQ columns from the regions of the qseaSet

    dropPooledControl()

    This function drops the PooledControl sample from the qseaSet, if it is present.

    encodeBlacklist

    2019 ENCODE blacklist of poorly mapped regions in hg38

    examplePairedTumourQset

    A small example qseaSet with 5 paired tumour/normal samples.

    filter(<qseaSet>)

    This function extends the dplyr function filter to act on qseaSet sampleTable.

    filterByNonOverlaps()

    Filter a qseaSet by non-overlaps with a GRanges object or table that can be coerced to one

    filterByOverlaps()

    Filter a qseaSet by overlaps with a GRanges object or table that can be coerced to one

    filterQset()

    This function takes a qseaSet and filters the samples in it based on a call to dplyr::filter on the sampleTable.

    filterRegions()

    This function takes a qseaSet object and filters the regions inside it by a call to dplyr::filter.

    fitQseaGLM()

    Fit a generalised linear model

    gc_hg38_1000kb gc_hg38_10kb gc_hg38_50kb gc_hg38_500kb

    GC content across the human genome build hg38/GRCh38

    getAnnotationDataFrame()

    This function generates a data frame to use for the annotation of heatmaps, when using groups

    getAnnotationDataFrameIndividual()

    This function generates a data frame to use for the annotation of heatmaps, using Individual sample names not group

    getBamCoveragePairedAndUnpairedR1()

    This function takes a bam file and gets the coverage over a set of regions. It keeps pairs or high quality R1s.

    getBetaMeans()

    This function takes a qseaSet and calculates the mean of the nrpm and beta values over the windows given by GRanges.

    getBetaTable()

    This function takes a qseaSet and makes a table of beta values

    getCGPositions()

    This function takes a GRanges object and calculates the enrichment scores.

    getCountTable()

    This function takes a qseaSet and makes a table of nrpm values

    getDMRsData()

    Extract the data table from all the contrasts

    getDataTable()

    This function takes a qseaSet and generates a table of data containing data for each sample

    getGenomicFeatureDistribution()

    This function takes a qseaSet and calculates some stats as to which genomic regions the reads lie.

    getNRPMTable()

    This function takes a qseaSet and makes a table of nrpm values

    getNormalisedReadSum()

    This function takes a qseaSet and sums over nrpm within a GRanges object

    getPCAwithBatch()

    This function edits the getPCA function from qsea to allow for batch effect correction

    getSampleQCSummary()

    This function returns the most important columns of a qseaSet with respect to quality controls

    getWindowNames()

    This function returns the window names from a data frame with DMR windows

    hg19ToHg38.over.chain

    hg19tohg38 liftover chain

    hg38CpGIslands

    CpG islands for hg38.

    hg38UltraStableProbes

    CpG islands for hg38.

    hg38_450kArrayGR

    Infinium 450k probe locations for hg38.

    is.qseaSet()

    Check if an object is a qseaSet

    keepWindowsOverCutoff()

    This function takes a qseaSet and keeps the windows which have expression above a cutoff in a defined set of samples

    leftJoinQset()

    This function takes a qseaSet and appends data to its sampleTable based on a call to dplyr::left_join

    left_join(<qseaSet>)

    This function extends the dplyr function left_join to act on qseaSet sampleTable.

    liftOverhg19()

    This function takes a genomic ranges object or data frame, and lifts over from hg19 to hg38.

    makeAllContrasts()

    Make a full set of contrasts

    makeQset()

    Make the initial qseaSet object from a set of samples

    makeTransposedTable()

    This function takes a qseaSet and makes a wide transposed table, suitable for using for machine learning

    map_hg38_1000kb map_hg38_10kb map_hg38_50kb map_hg38_500kb

    GC content across the human genome build hg38/GRCh38

    mergeQsetSamples()

    This function takes a qseaSet and merges samples together into a single sample.

    mixArrayWithQset()

    This function takes a qseaSet and makes a new sample by mixing two samples

    mixQsetSamples()

    This function takes a qseaSet and makes a new sample by mixing two samples

    mixThreeQsetSamples()

    This function takes a qseaSet and makes a new sample by mixing three samples

    mutate(<qseaSet>)

    This function extends the dplyr function mutate to act on qseaSet sampleTable.

    mutateQset()

    This function takes a qseaSet and mutates its sampleTable based on a call to dplyr::mutate.

    pivotDMRsLonger()

    This function transforms a DMR data frame from the wide format to a long format

    plotCNVheatmap()

    This function takes a qseaSet and plots a heatmap of the calculated CNV

    plotCorrelationMatrix()

    This function takes a qseaSet and plots a correlation matrix

    plotDMRUpSet()

    This function takes a DMRtable as output by calculateDMRs (possibly after any filtering), and generates an upset plot

    plotGRangesHeatmap()

    This function takes a qseaSet and a GRanges object, and plots the expression across the gene as a heatmap

    plotGeneHeatmap()

    This function takes a qseaSet and a gene, and plots the expression across the gene as a heatmap

    plotGenomicFeatureDistribution()

    This function takes a qseaSet and extracts the distribution of the genomic features of all the windows over a cutoff, and plots it

    plotQseaPCA()

    This function takes a qseaSet and plots a PCA

    pull(<qseaSet>)

    This function extends the dplyr function pull to act on qseaSet sampleTable.

    pullQset()

    This function takes a qseaSet and pulls a column from its sampleTable based on a call to dplyr::pull

    qseaTableToChrGRanges()

    Convert a table from makeTable into a GRanges object

    qseaWriteDMRsBeds()

    Write the qsea result to a set of bed file

    qseaWriteDMRsExcel()

    Write the qsea result to an Excel file

    relabelQset()

    This function takes a qseaSet and renames the samples based on a column of the sampleTable.

    removeCNV()

    This function takes a qseaSet and removes the CNV data.

    removeLibraryFactors()

    This function takes a qseaSet and sets all the library factor columns to one, including in the sampleTable.

    removeWindowsOverCutoff()

    This function takes a qseaSet and filters out windows which have expression in a defined set of samples

    remove_almost_empty_cols()

    This function removes columns that are mostly NA (with some proportion) Based off the janitor::remove_empty_cols function.

    renameQsetNames()

    Rename samples in a qseaSet.

    runHMMCopy()

    Function to call HMMcopy on the individual reads for a sample

    select(<qseaSet>)

    This function extends the dplyr function select to act on qseaSet sampleTable. Can also be used to rename columns.

    selectQset()

    This function takes a qseaSet and selects columns from its sampleTable based on a call to dplyr::select

    sort(<qseaSet>)

    This function extends the function sort to act on qseaSet, to reorder the names. It uses gtools::mixedsort to sort numbers correctly (i.e. 10 does not come before 2).

    sortQset()

    This function takes a qseaSet and sorts the samples in it, so they are in alphabetical order (with numbers increasing via mixedsort)

    subsetQset()

    Subset a qseaSet

    subsetWindowsOverBackground()

    This function takes a qseaSet and finds which windows have more reads than would be expected if the reads followed a Poisson distribution over the whole genome.

    summariseByGene()

    This function summarises a data frame by gene (using annotateData)

    summariseDMRsByContrast()

    This function summarises the number of windows called as up/down in each comparison in a . Internally transforms the data to a long format. Contrasts with no significant windows will be dropped!

    writeBigWigs()

    This function takes a qseaSet and writes individual bigWig files with the coverage over each window.

    Contents

    Developed by Simon Pearce, Steven Hill.
